intro: Youngia sonchifolia, commonly known as the common youngia, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, alternate leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming in late summer to early autumn. Youngia sonchifolia is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
